abstract: Officials at John Jay High School in San Antonio, Tex, say assistant football coach Mack Breed has recanted confession that he instructed players to attack referee during game, saying he confessed to protect players involved in assault; local prosecutors say they have not decided whether to levy charges against Breed or the players.
lead_paragraph: Officials from a San Antonio high school said an assistant football coach admitted ordering what became an infamous attack but then denied it, saying he had been trying to protect players.

headline.main: Aide Recants Ordering Attack on Texas Referee
headline.print_headline: Aide Recants Ordering Attack on Referee

snippet: Officials from a San Antonio high school said an assistant football coach admitted ordering what became an infamous attack but then denied it, saying he had been trying to protect players.
